revised_title: On the Agreement of North Polar Distances of Principal Fixed Stars
tldr: The author examines the North Polar distances of principal fixed stars as recorded by different astronomers, comparing the catalogues of Dublin and Greenwich with that of Konigsberg. The author finds that the catalogues of Dublin and Greenwich agree within narrow limits, and concludes that the mean southern motion, as deduced from the comparison of the two Greenwich catalogues, is an error. The author also discusses the differences in constants of refraction used in the catalogues and their impact on the accuracy of observations.
